maze package

Submodules

maze.maze module

Module to define maze.

class maze.maze.Maze(data=None)

Bases: object

Class representing a maze.

It contains maze data, it’s start position (upper left) and end position (lower right).

It allows user to load data from and save as CSV file, generate incidence matrix and find shortest path from start to end.

Parameters:

data (ndarray | None) –

dijkstra(incidence_matrix)

Performs the Dijkstra’s algorithm to find the shortest path in the maze.

Args:
indicence_matrix (sparse.lil_matrix): The incidence matrix

of the maze.

Returns:

np.ndarray: An array containing cells of the shortest path.

Parameters:

incidence_matrix (lil_matrix) –

Return type:

ndarray

draw_maze()

Creates a picture of the maze only (without any path).

Return type:

None

draw_maze_path()

Creates a picture of the maze, found shortest path included.

Return type:

None

find_shortest_path()

Finds the shortest path from upper left corner to lower right corner of the maze using incidence matrix and Dijkstra’s algorithm.

Args:

None

Returns:

list: A list with incides representing the shortest path.

Return type:

list

incidence_matrix()

Generates an incidence matrix of the maze.

Args:

None

Returns:

sparse.lil_matrix: The incidence matrix of the maze.

Return type:

lil_matrix

load_maze_csv(file_name)

Loads maze data from a CSV file.

Args:

file_name (str): The path to the CSV file with maze data.

Returns:

None

Parameters:

file_name (str) –

Return type:

None

save_maze_csv(file_name)

Saves the maze as a CSV file.

Args:

file_name (str): The name of the new CSV file.

Returns:

None

Parameters:

file_name (str) –

Return type:

None

maze.maze_templates module

Module to define maze templates.

class maze.maze_templates.MazeTemplate

Bases: object

Class representing templates for mazes.

It allows user to generate mazes from templates and add obstacles to it.

static empty(n)

Creates an empty maze with given size.

Args:

n (int): The size of the created maze.

Returns:

Maze: An empty maze with size n x n.

Parameters:

n (int) –

Return type:

Maze

static lines(n)

Creates a maze with line-shaped obstacles, each line with only one cell to go through.

Args:

n (int): The size of the created maze.

Returns:

Maze: A new maze with size n x n and line-shaped obstacles.

Parameters:

n (int) –

Return type:

Maze

static random_obstacles(template, max_obstacles)

Generates random obstacles to existing maze template and checks if maze still has solution (path).

Args:

template (Maze): The maze we add obstacles to. max_obstacles (int): The maximum amount of new obstacles.

Returns:

Maze: Modified maze with new obstacles.

Parameters:

  • template (Maze) –

  • max_obstacles (int) –

Return type:

Maze

static slalom(n)

Creates a maze with two L-shaped obstacles (so that the path is at least S-shaped).

Args:

n (int): The size of the created maze.

Returns:

Maze: A new maze with size n x n and L-shaped obstacles.

Parameters:

n (int) –

Return type:

Maze

Module contents

This is a maze package.

It contains following modules: - maze: contains a Maze class - maze_templates: containcs a MazeTemplate class

class maze.Maze(data=None)

Bases: object

Class representing a maze.

It contains maze data, it’s start position (upper left) and end position (lower right).

It allows user to load data from and save as CSV file, generate incidence matrix and find shortest path from start to end.

Parameters:

data (ndarray | None) –

Performs the Dijkstra’s algorithm to find the shortest path in the maze.

Args:
indicence_matrix (sparse.lil_matrix): The incidence matrix

of the maze.

Returns:

np.ndarray: An array containing cells of the shortest path.

Parameters:

incidence_matrix (lil_matrix) –

class maze.MazeTemplate

Bases: object

Class representing templates for mazes.

It allows user to generate mazes from templates and add obstacles to it.
